{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Dropcam |model=DROPCAM3-HD/B |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=10/12/2012 |manuf_country=China |manuf=Chicony Electronics |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=camera |fcc_id=ADQ-HD3002 |ic_id= |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=USB Male Micro-B |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Ambarella |cpu1_model= |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=128 |fla1_brand=Samsung |fla1_model=K9F1G08U0D-SCB0 |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=256 |ram1_brand=Samsung |ram1_model=K4B2G1646C-HCH9 |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=AR6103G |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=1 |wi1_rxchains=1 |wi1_sstreams=1 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none=true |eth_cpu= |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed= |lan_ports= |wan_ports= |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui= |oui_eth= |default_ch= }} '''Designed in California, USA''', '''Assembled in China'''
Per the FCC photos, this device is using... *an '''Ambarella''' SoC *128MB NAND Flash and 256MB RAM (both from '''Samsung''') *an '''Atheros''' AR6103G-BM2D WiFi chip *an '''AKM''' AK4642 16-bit stereo ADC/DAC *a '''Texas Instruments''' TPS65053 power management IC "PN:0D16AC646L-B01" and "Rev: B1" ''appears'' to be silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
http://www.dropcam.com/
